wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Mortimer (1885–1964) was a British actor.
Son of Charles Neil Mortimer - actor.
Husband of Greta Wood - actress.

response: * Charles Mortimer played Lestrade in The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes (1935).

In 1935, Wontner returned to the role for The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes. For this film, Wontner jettisoned the toupée and Ian Fleming returned to the role of Dr. Watson. Lyn Harding took over the role of Professor Moriarty from Norman McKinnel, and Charles Mortimer took over the role of Inspector Lestrade from Philip Hewland. Wonter's age, fifty-nine by this time, was too difficult to hide so Holmes is on the verge of retiring. The film is a very accurate adaptation of The Valley of Fear. The film received rave reviews which would lead to one final film.
